abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column notes that Game 7 of the World Series between St Louis Cardinals and Texas Rangers was the 38th postseason game of a possible 41, matching the most ever in the 17 years of the current playoff format; holds that any thing less than a seven-game World Series would have felt wrong for this most wondrous of baseball seasons.
snippet: Game 7 between the Cardinals and Rangers was the 38th postseason game of a possible 41, matching the most ever in the 17 years of the current playoff format.
lead_paragraph: Game 7 between the Cardinals and Rangers was the 38th postseason game of a possible 41, matching the most ever in the 17 years of the current playoff format.

headline.main: Riveting Series Caps a Scintillating Season
headline.print_headline: Riveting Series Caps A Remarkable Season
